full_summary:
### National Public Alerting System (NPAS) Invitation to Tender

#### Reference 

* Solicitation Number: WS4681715453
* Reference Number: WS4681715453-Doc4704620661
* Publication Date: July 26, 2024
* Closing Date: July 26, 2024, 2:00 PM Eastern Daylight Time (EDT)
 
#### Notice Type
This is a Request for Information (RFI) for the National Public Alerting System (NPAS). 

#### Contracting Entity
* Contracting Entity Name: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
* Contracting Entity Address: 11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage, Gatineau, Quebec, K1A 0S5, Canada

#### Scope
The PSPC invites bidders to participate in an RFIs tender process for the NPAS project.

#### Overview
The proposed NPAS is aimed to provide a nationwide public alert system for Canada. The system would be responsible for disseminating critical information to the masses during emergency situations. Selected bidder will provide services to deliver a cutting-edge alert system that connects Canadians throughout the country, leveraging the latest technologies to enhance the alert system's reliability, scalability, and accessibility.

#### Interested Suppliers
Interested suppliers are invited to provide information and clarify expectations related to the NPAS project. The objective of this process is to better understand the supplier's capabilities, experience, and resources available to deliver the proposed services.

#### Contact Information
For more information regarding this tender opportunity, interested bidders may contact:
* Matthew Young (SPAC/PSPC)
* Email: matthew.young@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

#### Limitations
This invitation to tender is not a call for proposals and is a request for information only. No contract will be awarded during this process. No response to this tender will engage a commitment by the PSPC to the invited supplier, nor shall any information, ideas, or suggestions received be considered confidential or proprietary.

**Technical Specifications**
Selected bidder will need to install a robust nationwide public alert system that meets the requirements. Some technical specifications include:
- Software development and integration with existing infrastructure
- Scalable architecture for handling extensive sensing and coverage of regions involved
- Real-time information delivery system to key stakeholders and end-users

Please refer to **[Agency Single Point of Contact and on-line documentation platform - more information can be requested using company email and allocated inquiry reference N/A]**
